title: Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Daegu
text:
The Archdiocese of Daegu (previously known as Taiku or Taegu) is a <a href="particular%20church">particular church</a> of the <a href="Latin%20Rite">Latin Rite</a> of the <a href="Roman%20Catholic%20Church">Catholic Church</a>. The Archbishop of Daegu, whose <a href="cathedra">seat</a> is at <a href="Kyesan%20Cathedral">Kyesan Cathedral</a> in <a href="Daegu">Daegu</a>, is <a href="Metropolitan%20bishop">Metropolitan bishop</a> for the Dioceses of <a href="Diocese%20of%20Andong">Andong</a>, <a href="Diocese%20of%20Cheongju">Cheongju</a>, <a href="Diocese%20of%20Masan">Masan</a>, and <a href="Roman%20Catholic%20Diocese%20of%20Busan">Busan</a>.
It is the second oldest <a href="episcopal%20see">episcopal see</a> in <a href="Korea">Korea</a>, erected as an <a href="apostolic%20vicariate">apostolic vicariate</a> on April 8, 1911, from the Apostolic Vicariate of Korea. It was elevated to archdiocesan status on March 10, 1962.
